summary: This bill, H.R. 2186, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore the limitation on downward attribution of stock ownership when applying constructive ownership rules. It also introduces provisions concerning 'foreign controlled United States shareholders' and 'foreign controlled foreign corporations,' specifying how Subpart F of part III of subchapter N of chapter 1 should be applied in these scenarios. The bill aims to clarify and potentially expand the scope of tax regulations related to foreign corporations and their U.S. shareholders, with an effective date applicable to specific taxable years.
